THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON
11.01.2024, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING:

mo)
CRL.MC NO. 241 OF 2024 ELIZ
BECHU KURIAN THOMAS, J.
~ Cri.M.C. No. 241 of 2024
Dated this the 11" day of January, 2024
ORDER

Petitioner is the 1* accused in C.C No.2734 of 2015 on the
files of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Thalassery,
facing prosecution for the offences under Sections 406, 419,
420, 468, 471 and 120B of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.

2. Petitioner contends that, on 20.01.2023, due to the
failure of the petitioner to appear before the court, a non
bailable warrant has been issued, after canceling the bail. The
petitioner seeks for a direction to consider his applications for
recall of warrant and grant of bail on the day of appearance
itself.

3. Sri. Sarin, learned counsel for the petitioner contends
that, petitioner is suffering from various health issues and that,
she is undergoing medical treatment and hence, failure on
20.01.2023 was not willful.

4. | heard Smt. Sreeja V., learned Public Prosecutor as
well.

ail
i . ee]
pat
2024/KER/2897
CRL.MC NO. 241 OF 2024

5. Since a non bailable warrant has been issued against
the petitioner for her failure to appear on 20.01.2023 and she
has undertaken to appear before the court within the next 15
days. | am of the view that, a liberal approach can be adopted
and the application, if any filed by her can be directed to be
considered on the same day itself.

6. Accordingly, there will be a direction to the the
Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Thalassery to consider the
application, if any filed by the petitioner for recall of warrant
and for bail on the same day of her appearance itself provided
such applications are filed within 15 days from today. The non
bailable warrant issued against the petitioner will be kept in
abeyance for a period of 15 days from today, to enable the
petitioner to comply with the above directions.

The Criminal Miscellaneous Case is disposed of.

Sd/-
BECHU KURIAN THOMAS
JUDGE
